page.title: 03EASTERFIELD PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: {Easterfield}is a small rural{school which first admitted children in{1870. At that time the school comprised one building and housed{three classes.}In {1921}the roll was{48}but attendance at school varied from day to day depending on the needs of the local farmers.{Potato picking}time was an occasion when few children attended school. The{weather}also played a part in restricting attendance as some children had to walk several miles to school. A{hall}was built in the{1930's which was used as a{Dance Hall. Eventually this became part of the school and is now a classroom for the {Infant Class.}The{Main Building}now comprises{one class, kitchen, office and{toilets.}In{1985}the roll is{26 with{2 full time teachers}and visiting staff in{Art, PE}and{Music.
